block.p: Mallory Anne Call, a daughter of Judy E. Call and James R. Call of Larchmont, N.Y., was married on Friday to Stephen Andrew Chinn, a son of Nancy Chinn of Oakland, Calif., and the Rev. Calvin Chinn of Alameda, Calif. The bridegroom's father, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony in Nantucket, Mass.

Mrs. Chinn, 23, teaches seventh-grade social studies at the Robert E. Bell Middle School in Chappaqua, N.Y., and is also a candidate for a master's degree in reading instruction at Manhattanville College. She graduated from New York University. Her father is a vice president at the NPD Group, a market research company in Port Washington, N.Y. Her mother is a manager at the A. I. Friedman art supply store in Port Chester, N.Y.

Mallory Anne Call, a daughter of Judy E. Call and James R. Call of Larchmont, N.Y., was married on Friday to Stephen Andrew Chinn, a son of Nancy Chinn of Oakland, Calif., and the Rev. Calvin Chinn of Alameda, Calif. The bridegroom's father, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony in Nantucket, Mass.

Mrs. Chinn, 23, teaches seventh-grade social studies at the Robert E. Bell Middle School in Chappaqua, N.Y., and is also a candidate for a master's degree in reading instruction at Manhattanville College. She graduated from New York University. Her father is a vice president at the NPD Group, a market research company in Port Washington, N.Y. Her mother is a manager at the A. I. Friedman art supply store in Port Chester, N.Y.

Mr. Chinn, 30, teaches music at the Mamaroneck Avenue School, a public elementary school in Mamaroneck, N.Y. He graduated from the Berklee College of Music and received a master's degree in jazz performance from the State University College at Purchase, N.Y. His mother is a liturgical artist in Oakland. His father is a minister at the Chinatown Presbyterian Church in San Francisco.
